medical_history.chief_complaint: Disseminated phaeohyphomycosis due to Exophiala spinifera.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced symptoms consistent with disseminated phaeohyphomycosis starting in October 1990. Over the years, there were multiple relapses, particularly worsening during pregnancy in June 1999, with lymphadenopathy, fever, and skin lesions becoming severe, leading to an emergency cesarean section in November 1999.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes asthma controlled with intermittent corticosteroid therapy about 10 years prior and congenital renal agenesis.
medical_history.family_history: The patientâ€™s sister had phaeohyphomycosis (due to Alternaria tenuis) and had two children with Down syndrome.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not use tobacco products or consume alcohol.
